Subject: "The LAN Manager Authentication Level allows the use of NTLMv1 or LM' / "Hardened Paths have been mo
Description:
Please also see the information in closed ticket: 00437923. 

In one of our Active Directory domains PingCastle the alerts "The LAN Manager Authentication Level allows the use of NTLMv1 or LM not being AND and "Hardened Paths have been modified to lower the security level" pops up.

We verified this GPO setting in our Policies within that AD domain, the settings exist and are set correctly. We do suspect that this is an issue with PingCastle not correctly/fully loading all Group Policy Objects from this domain so it can not verify that this setting exists.

The requested information is attached to this ticket
What_We_Know__c:
In one Active Directory domains PingCastle alerts "The LAN Manager Authentication Level allows the use of NTLMv1 or LM not being AND and "Hardened Paths have been modified to lower the security level" are showing

Verified GPO setting in Policies within that AD domain, the settings exist and are set correctly.
Solution_Comment__c: The System (Computer) account, used by the PingCastle schedule, did not have read permissions on some of the Group Policy Objects. After adjusting that, PingCastle is showing the correct results.
